intro: Ruellia scabrosa, commonly known as rough ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, blue to purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Ruellia scabrosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant colors and drought tolerance. Its rough, hairy texture gives it a distinctive appearance, making it easily identifiable in gardens and natural habitats.
